english: peduncle; fruit stem; flower base; calyx

etymology.interpretation: 艸 signals a plant-related meaning, pointing to parts like stems or calyxes. 帝 provides the sound value (dì), guiding pronunciation while adding little to the meaning.

examples.chinese: 把苹果的蒂摘掉(把蘋果的蒂摘掉)。
examples.pinyin: Bǎ píngguǒ de dì zhāi diào.

examples.chinese: 西红柿的果蒂要先去掉(西紅柿的果蒂要先去掉)。
examples.pinyin: Xīhóngshì de guǒdì yào xiān qù diào.

examples.chinese: 花谢后(花謝後)，蒂还留在枝上(蒂還留在枝上)。
examples.pinyin: Huā xiè hòu, dì hái liú zài zhī shàng.
examples.english: After the flowers wither, the stem base still remains on the branch.
